name: correlatively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that happens because of an important relationship between two things: We observed that the two amounts were increasing correlatively. If AB is the product of A and B, then CD will be correlatively the product of C and D.
More examplesFewer examplesThe jury noted the defendant's shocking experience and, correlatively, his mental state at the time of the incident.Our moral rights correlatively entail certain moral duties.She argues that science is linked with philosophy and, correlatively, that philosophy is linked with science.
